requirement_tested: Display a list of available polls for users to browse
user_persona: A casual visitor interested in participating in community polls.
user_goal: Browse through the available polls to find something interesting to vote on.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens the polls website and expects to see a list of available polls right away.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A vertically scrollable page with a white background and navy-colored poll cards is displayed, each showing the poll's title, short description, creation date, and category.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Poll Cards
narrative_steps.description: Sarah scrolls down to look at more poll options and notices the visually distinct cards.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: More poll cards load dynamically as she scrolls, maintaining consistent styling with titles and descriptions clearly visible.

narrative_steps.title: Opening a Poll
narrative_steps.description: One poll catches Sarah’s attention. She clicks on it to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a poll card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The detailed view of the selected poll opens, displaying full information and voting options.

requirement_tested: Allow users to select and vote for specific poll options
user_persona: A registered user ready to participate in a poll.
user_goal: Cast a vote for her preferred option in a chosen poll.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Voting Options
narrative_steps.description: On the poll detail page, Maria sees several voting options presented as clickable divs.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to a poll detail page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Radio buttons or clickable navy-ston divs representing each voting option are visible under the poll question.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting an Option
narrative_steps.description: Maria decides which option she supports and selects it.
narrative_steps.action: Click on one of the voting options.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The selected option becomes visually highlighted, indicating that it has been chosen.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting the Vote
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with her choice, Maria submits her vote.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Submit Vote' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Her selection is sent via a POST request to the voting endpoint, and the system records her vote.

requirement_tested: Show real-time or updated voting results after submission
user_persona: A curious participant wanting to know how others voted.
user_goal: See the updated voting results immediately after casting a vote.

narrative_steps.title: Casting a Vote
narrative_steps.description: Tom votes for his favorite movie genre in a poll about entertainment preferences.
narrative_steps.action: Select an option and click 'Submit Vote'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: His vote is recorded successfully, triggering an immediate update to the results.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Updated Results
narrative_steps.description: After submitting, Tom looks forward to seeing how others have voted so far.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for automatic redirection or observe changes on the same page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A horizontal bar graph with navy bars appears instantly, showing percentage distribution among all options along with total votes count.

narrative_steps.title: Manual Refresh Check
narrative_steps.description: Curious whether there were additional votes since his submission, Tom manually refreshes the results.
narrative_steps.action: Click the refresh button next to the results chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Latest data is fetched from the results API and the chart updates to reflect the most current statistics.

requirement_tested: Implement a clean user interface with white background
user_persona: A first-time user exploring the site’s layout.
user_goal: Easily navigate the site without visual distractions.

narrative_steps.title: Loading the Site
narrative_steps.description: Jamie visits the polls website for the first time and notices the overall cleanliness of the design.
narrative_steps.action: Open the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The entire application presents a solid white background across all visible sections, providing a clean aesthetic.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Content
narrative_steps.description: As Jamie explores different parts of the site, he appreciates the uncluttered presentation.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate between various pages (e.g., poll list, poll detail, results).
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each page maintains the white background theme consistently, ensuring no abrupt shifts in visual tone.

requirement_tested: Style all UI components with navy color scheme
user_persona: A returning user familiar with the platform’s look and feel.
user_goal: Experience consistent branding throughout the site.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Consistent Styling
narrative_steps.description: Dana logs into the site again and immediately recognizes the familiar navy-themed interface.
narrative_steps.action: Load any page within the application.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All buttons, headers, links, form controls, and active states utilize consistent navy coloring, reinforcing brand identity.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Elements
narrative_steps.description: While navigating, Dana interacts with various elements, noting their uniform appearance.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over buttons, click links, open menus.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Every interactive element responds with subtle hover effects but retains the dominant navy color palette.

requirement_tested: Enable users to view detailed poll information before voting
user_persona: An informed voter who wants context before making a decision.
user_goal: Understand the full scope of a poll before deciding how to vote.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Detailed View
narrative_steps.description: Liam clicks on a poll titled “Favorite Programming Language” to get more insights.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a poll card from the main list.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He lands on a detailed view displaying the extended description, creation timestamp, creator name, and categorized tags beneath the main question heading.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Information
narrative_steps.description: Liam carefully reads through the provided details to make an educated decision.
narrative_steps.action: Read the detailed content and metadata associated with the poll.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Full information including long-form description and metadata helps him understand the poll better.

narrative_steps.title: Returning to Poll List
narrative_steps.description: Not yet convinced, Liam decides to go back and explore other polls.
narrative_steps.action: Click the back button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He returns smoothly to the poll list without losing previous navigation state.

requirement_tested: Provide visual feedback when a vote is successfully submitted
user_persona: A cautious user who likes confirmation of actions taken.
user_goal: Receive clear acknowledgment that his vote was accepted.

narrative_steps.title: Voting Successfully
narrative_steps.description: Emma casts her vote in a poll about favorite pizza toppings.
narrative_steps.action: Choose an option and click 'Submit Vote'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A green checkmark animation briefly plays near the submit button, followed by a toast message confirming receipt of her vote.

narrative_steps.title: Acknowledging Feedback
narrative_steps.description: Emma watches the confirmation animation and feels reassured that her input was processed.
narrative_steps.action: Observe the visual feedback sequence.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The animated checkmark fades out gracefully, leaving Emma confident that her participation was recorded.

requirement_tested: Ensure poll results are displayed in an easily understandable format
user_persona: A data-oriented user interested in interpreting poll outcomes.
user_goal: Quickly grasp the distribution of votes across different options.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Poll Results
narrative_steps.description: Noah checks the results of a recently closed poll about travel destinations.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the results section of the poll.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results are displayed as labeled horizontal bars with percentages overlaying each segment, accompanied by a total votes count above the chart.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Data Visually
narrative_steps.description: Noah examines the bar graph to compare popularity levels among the options.
narrative_steps.action: Study the visual representation of the results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The proportional sizing of the bars makes it easy for Noah to interpret the relative popularity of each option at a glance.

requirement_tested: Include navigation between different sections of the website
user_persona: A frequent user who moves around the site often.
user_goal: Effortlessly switch between browsing polls, checking results, and managing personal activity.

narrative_steps.title: Using Top Navigation Bar
narrative_steps.description: Grace starts on the homepage and wants to check her past votes.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'My Votes' link in the top navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She transitions smoothly to the My Votes section without experiencing a full page reload.

narrative_steps.title: Switching Contexts
narrative_steps.description: From there, Grace wants to return to browsing new polls.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Home' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected back to the poll list, maintaining seamless navigation flow.

requirement_tested: Maintain user session or tracking to prevent duplicate voting
user_persona: A responsible user who respects fair voting practices.
user_goal: Contribute once per poll while trusting the system to enforce integrity.

narrative_steps.title: First-Time Voting
narrative_steps.description: Alex votes in a poll about preferred programming languages.
narrative_steps.action: Cast a vote in the poll.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: His vote is accepted and recorded successfully with no issues.

narrative_steps.title: Attempting Duplicate Vote
narrative_steps.description: Later, Alex tries to vote again in the same poll, either intentionally or accidentally.
narrative_steps.action: Try to vote again in the same poll.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An alert pops up stating 'You’ve already voted in this poll,' preventing him from submitting another vote.

requirement_tested: Display poll creation date and relevant metadata
user_persona: A researcher collecting historical polling data.
user_goal: Identify when each poll was created and gather contextual information.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Poll Card Metadata
narrative_steps.description: Taylor browses the poll list looking for recent topics.
narrative_steps.action: Scan through poll cards on the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each card includes small italicized text showing the creation time, author, and category, helping Taylor assess relevance.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Detailed View Metadata
narrative_steps.description: Taylor opens a poll to verify exact timestamps and authorship.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a specific poll card to view details.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: In the detailed view, extended metadata including creation timestamp, last updated time, and author name are clearly displayed.

requirement_tested: Implement responsive design for various screen sizes
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the site during commute hours.
user_goal: Use the site effectively on smaller screens without loss of functionality.

narrative_steps.title: Mobile Browsing Experience
narrative_steps.description: Jordan accesses the polls website from his smartphone while commuting.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the site on a mobile browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout adjusts automatically to fit the narrow screen, with columns stacking and fonts scaling appropriately for readability.

narrative_steps.title: Tablet Adaptation
narrative_steps.description: At home, Jordan switches to his tablet for a larger view.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the window or switch devices to a tablet.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The interface adapts once more, optimizing space usage and touch target sizes for improved usability on medium-sized screens.

requirement_tested: Include error handling for invalid selections or submissions
user_persona: A user prone to occasional mistakes while interacting online.
user_goal: Get helpful guidance when encountering errors during voting.

narrative_steps.title: Invalid Submission Attempt
narrative_steps.description: Casey forgets to choose an option before clicking 'Submit Vote'.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Submit Vote' without selecting any option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: An inline error message appears below the voting options, prompting Casey to make a selection before proceeding.

narrative_steps.title: Resolving Error
narrative_steps.description: Casey corrects his mistake by choosing an option this time.
narrative_steps.action: Select an option and try submitting again.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The error message disappears, and his vote is successfully submitted with proper feedback.

requirement_tested: Provide accessibility features for inclusive user experience
user_persona: A visually impaired user relying on assistive technologies.
user_goal: Navigate and interact with the site independently using screen readers.

narrative_steps.title: Keyboard Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Riley prefers using keyboard shortcuts instead of a mouse due to motor limitations.
narrative_steps.action: Press the Tab key repeatedly to cycle through interactive elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Focus moves logically from one actionable item to the next, following standard reading order, with visible focus indicators.

narrative_steps.title: Screen Reader Compatibility
narrative_steps.description: Riley uses a screen reader to hear descriptions of UI elements.
narrative_steps.action: Activate screen reader software and navigate the site.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Descriptive labels accompany all interactive elements, and semantic HTML ensures accurate interpretation by assistive tools.

requirement_tested: Enable sorting or filtering of polls by categories or dates
user_persona: A power user who likes organizing content efficiently.
user_goal: Find specific types of polls quickly using filters.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Sort Menu
narrative_steps.description: Quinn wants to see only technology-related polls posted recently.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Filter' icon in the top navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A dropdown menu labeled 'Sort By' opens, offering options like Recent, Popular, and By Category.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Filters
narrative_steps.description: Quinn chooses 'Category' and then selects 'Technology' from the sub-menu.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'By Category' and then choose 'Technology'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The poll list refreshes instantly, displaying only those categorized under Technology, sorted by recency.
